alert.note: Alert for Olympics (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 3:09PM PST until February 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...A PAIR OF FRONTAL SYSTEMS TO AFFECT THE AREA... .Snow returns to the Olympics and Cascades tonight as the first of a series of frontal systems arrives. Snow levels will rise with a secondary system on Monday, but it could produce impactful snow at Stevens Pass before the snow level rises above the pass. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 18 inches. * WHERE...Olympic mountains, including Hurricane Ridge. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.
